data.title: Facebook to hide number of likes in trial aimed at improving users' wellbeing
data.text: Social media giant said the move was backed by anti-bullying and mental health groups

data.title: Facebook Tests Hiding ‘Likes’ on Social Media Posts
data.text: The social network, which has been under fire for extreme content on its site, said it was testing making Likes to posts private in Australia.

data.title: Tech execs think Facebook most likely to face punishment in antitrust probe: survey
data.text: A new CNBC technology executive council survey found that 56 percent of respondents think Facebook will face the most punitive action as Washington continues its antitrust probe.

data.title: RBC's Mahaney: Facebook sell-off over antitrust investigation is 'overdone'
data.text: Mark Mahaney, RBC Capital Markets analyst, and Nuveen's Stephanie Link joins CNBC's "Closing Bell" to discuss Facebook's large antitrust liabilities as lawmakers probe.

data.title: Women, older job seekers excluded in Facebook ad targeting
data.text: Yahoo Finance's Dan Howley breaks down why Facebook and other companies may have violated  EEOC laws.

data.title: Facebook grows to 5,000 employees in Seattle region, opens its 18th office at downtown tower
data.text: Facebook’s footprint in the Seattle area continues to grow as the social media giant now employs more than 5,000 people across the region.

data.title: Facebook: Investors Must Face (New) Reality
data.text: Every investor should have noticed that the importance of antitrust related topics is increasing exorbitantly and is also becoming increasingly important for their own due diligence.

data.title: Facebook (FB) to Not Remove "Newsworthy" Political Content
data.text: Facebook (FB) to keep political content even if it violates its standards, and regulate false content and enhance ad transparency measures ahead of U.S. and Singapore elections.

data.title: Facebook wins dismissal of investor lawsuit over privacy breach
data.text: Facebook Inc and its chief executive Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday won dismissal of an investor lawsuit accusing them of deceiving investors about the likely impact of a privacy breach on its stock price, though the investors will be have a chance to refile their case.

data.title: Can Facebook And Google Detect And Stop Deepfakes?
data.text: Deepfakes have started to appear everywhere.

data.title: Facebook remains top target for disinformation, study says
data.text: A University of Oxford study looks at how governments and political parties are trying to manipulate the masses.

data.title: Thursday’s Vital Data: Beyond Meat, Facebook and Boeing
data.text: Options trading was buzzing in Beyond Meat, Facebook and Boeing on Wednesday. Here are the metrics that matter moving forward.

data.title: Facebook is the tech giant most likely to be punished in Silicon Valley antitrust crackdown
data.text: As the federal government broadens its antitrust review of big tech companies, Facebook is the Silicon Valley target with the most to fear, say technology executives surveyed by CNBC.

data.text: Facebook Inc. is reportedly facing a fresh regulatory probe, as a report said the U.S.

data.title: Facebook Agrees to Buy CTRL-labs, Focuses on AR Initiatives (Revised)
data.text: Facebook (FB) to acquire New York-based startup CTRL-labs, which is developing a technology to let people control computers through brain signal.

data.title: Facebook reportedly facing another antitrust probe -- from DOJ
data.text: Social networking giant is already facing investigations from the FTC, the House antitrust committee and a host of attorneys general.
